description._content: Guests dining at Malia Jensen's table can expect to see Salty: Extended Play. These carved salt-lick breasts are part of a series that includes a video (Salty, 2010) and a group of photographs shot at a New Mexico ranch. With cows as willing but unwitting collaborators, simple relationships are turned ambiguous, complex and suggestive. Courtesy of the Artist and Cristin Tierney Gallery, NY. On Wednesday evening, April 18, 2012, the Brooklyn Museum will host its annual fundraising gala, the Brooklyn Artists Ball. This year’s ball will celebrate women artists and recognize the fifth anniversary of the Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art. Guests will dine at table environments created for the occasion by sixteen Brooklyn women artists selected by the Museum’s curators. Each artist will transform a 40-foot-long table into a new work of art that will be on view for one night only. Brooklyn Artists Ball April 18, 2012 www.brooklynmuseum.org/calendar/event/5132
